citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection, the facility was housing nine guinea pigs and two hamsters in outdoor enclosures. Hamsters are
sensitive to temperature extremes and shall not be housed in outdoor facilities. Guinea pigs are also sensitive to
temperature extremes and shall not be housed in outdoor facilities unless such facilities are located in an appropriate
climate and prior approval for such outdoor housing is obtained from the Deputy Administrator. The guinea pigs and
hamsters shall be moved to indoor enclosures that provide adequate climate control. To be corrected by March 31, 2023.

One rabbit was housed in an enclosure with five guinea pigs. Another enclosure contained six rabbits, two guinea pigs,
and a bird. Rabbits should not be housed with other species unless for scientific reasons. Housing rabbits with other
animals may have a negative impact on the health and well-being of either animal, due to the potential spread of diseases
between species and risk of injury. The licensee shall ensure that rabbits are not housed in the same primary enclosure
with other species. To be corrected by March 31, 2023.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection, there was no documented environmental enhancement program for the two non-human
primates housed at the facility. An adequate environmental enhancement program is essential in promoting the
psychological well-being of non-human primates. Dealers. Exhibitors, and research facilities must develop, document, and
follow an appropriate plan for environment enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of non-human
primates, it must be in accordance with the currently accepted professional standards and as directed by the attending
veterinarian. The licensee must ensure that a documented plan for environmental enrichment that addresses the required
elements is maintained and available for inspection. To be corrected by April 20, 2023.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the licensee.
